channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Higher
item.description: Gold settled 1.2% higher and silver rose nearly 0.7%, with both metals up for three consecutive sessions.

item.title: American Express to Pay $230 Million in Fines for Aggressive Sales Practices
item.description: The Wall Street Journal had reported on a series of deceptive and strong-arm tactics the card company used to increase small business sign-ups.

item.title: Dow Slips; Investors Dig Into More Bank Earnings
item.description: The Nasdaq, S&P 500 and Dow industrials were pulled lower by declines in large tech shares. Bank of America and Morgan Stanley said profit more than d...

item.title: Mortgage rates rise past a key mark, signaling bad news for home buyers
item.description: The 30-year mortgage rate inched up for the fifth week in a row, Freddie Mac says, making it more expensive to take on a mortgage.

item.title: Fixed-Income Investors Wrestle With Higher Yields Ahead of Inauguration
item.description: Bond investors are in for a bumpier ride than usual, as Treasury yields are expected to move sharply in the coming weeks on the heels of an unpredicta...

item.title: More homeowners are being denied insurance. The L.A. fires can be a turning point.
item.description: Government should focus on these 3 questions to help find solutions.

item.title: Biden warns that an oligarchy is taking hold in America. There is data to back him up.
item.description: Wealth disparity in the U.S. has grown since 2009, according to Fed data, with a significant increase in the share of the nation’s wealth held by the ...

item.title: Quantum-computing stocks could be rich takeover targets. Here’s what to know.
item.description: Innovative startups could help tech giants capitalize on this world-changing application.

item.title: UPS could help end the ‘freight recession’ this year. It may have to raise prices first.
item.description: Analysts say deregulation, lower taxes under Trump could spur small-business investments and more shipments — but tariffs could weigh down volumes.

item.title: What Happens When Your House Burns Down and You Still Have a Mortgage?
item.description: Borrowers are still on the hook but might be able to pause payments.
